chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy A. Perry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jeremy A. Perry is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jeremy A. Perry was found guilty of Hit and Run, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:00 AM
Defendant Jeremy A. Perry appeared with Attorney Christopher R. Bub; defendant in custody.
Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Kimberly Keel.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:
Victim rights compliance.
Def. in-custody in Indiana.
Defendant entered a plea of Guilty to Ct 1-H&R; found guilty by the court.
Cts 2 & 3 were dismissed outright on State's motion.
Ct 1:
Court orders a $300 fine plus costs, plus DNA surcharge, due in 60 days or civil judgment.  
Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.
Extradition costs of $975 ordered.
Appeal rights given.
Copy of minutes mailed to the jail.

10:50 AM Defendant, Jeremy A. Perry, appeared with Attorney Christopher R. Bub.  Attorney Jennifer A. Phan appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Kimberly Keel.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:
Victim rights compliance.
Issue w/restitution, matter set over.
Plea/sentencing hearing rescheduled for March 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.

09:19 AM
 Defendant Jeremy A. Perry appeared by phone means and in-custody.
 Attorney Christopher R. Bub in court for Defendant Jeremy A. Perry.
 Attorney Zachary L Brost in court for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Kimberly Keel.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:
Victim rights compliance.
Matter is resolved and there's an interstate detainer issue.
Atty did not inform the court of a plea hrg today and def. was not brought over.
Bond continued.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 25, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Jury selection on March 7, 2022 at 08:30 am. RE:  Speedy Trial Demand filed on 12/23/2022.

Defendant Jeremy A Perry appeared with Attorney Christopher R. Bub.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Emily K. Gaertner appeared for the Prosecution.
